intro: Biscutella valentina var. varia, commonly known as the pink sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, pink or white flowers in clusters during the spring. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in alpine ecosystems.
